repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
I was going through the code of vim.system so that I could adapt it to be used outside of nvim in something else, and I noticed something.

In setup_env, some needed logic was being bypassed only when clear_env == true

While one COULD technically use the env argument anyway if they did the logic themselves before passing it, it behaves VERY differently than with clear_env == false (the default) and doesnt fit the type annotations either, thus this is clearly unintentional and should be fixed.

comment_data.body:
how is this passing on windows CI? 

we have `n.testprg('shell-test')` which provides a fake shell that works on all platforms.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/efd0fa55c8b1ba78692382c52a9d644fdd5488c8/test/functional/ex_cmds/make_spec.lua#L27

 or maybe `n.testprg('printenv-test')` is more useful for this case.

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/efd0fa55c8b1ba78692382c52a9d644fdd5488c8/test/functional/vimscript/let_spec.lua#L70
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -68,6 +68,23 @@ describe('vim.system', function()
         eq('hellocat', system({ 'cat' }, { stdin = 'hellocat', text = true }).stdout)
       end)
 
+      it('can set environment', function()
+        eq(
+          'TESTVAL\n',
+          system({ 'bash' }, { stdin = 'echo $TEST', env = { TEST = 'TESTVAL' }, text = true }).stdout
+        )
+      end)
+
+      it('can set environment with clear_env = true', function()
+        eq(
+          'TESTVAL\n',
+          system(
+            { 'bash' },

comment_data.body:
`testprg('printenv-test')`

oh much better ty

I was also confused

comment_data.body: In the old code if `env` was `nil` and `clear_env` was `true`, this would return `nil`, and this is what Gitsigns was relying on.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -211,15 +211,13 @@ end
 --- @param clear_env? boolean
 --- @return string[]?
 local function setup_env(env, clear_env)
-  if clear_env then
-    return env
+  if not clear_env then

comment_regular_data.body:
I wish I made a new branch for this PR :cry:

It being the master branch of my fork is somewhat annoying (and entirely my fault)

Regardless, when someone gets around to checking this out it should be fairly trivial.
Are you able to add a test?

Most likely! Will look into it.

Edit: done!

`TEST_FILTER='vim.system' make functionaltest`

The second of the added tests fail with the old version and works with the new!

Oh... wait...

My test runs bash...

This may fail the windows tests. I suppose I will wait and find out if I end up with an :x: or a :heavy_check_mark:

Edit: Nope! The test works on windows!

That [freebsd test failure](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33955/checks?check_run_id=44665221077) doesnt look like it is my fault?

Unsure? The error wasn't happening before and I only added a test? It looks like a network issue.

```
    error: downloading 'https://github.com/luvit/luv/archive/1.50.0-1.tar.gz' failed
          status_code: 22
          status_string: "HTTP response code said error"
          log:
          --- LOG BEGIN ---
          timeout on name lookup is not supported
```

Maybe just re run that one if its the only one left?
Freebsd fails all the time, don't worry about that
Looks like this might have broken Gitsigns https://github.com/lewis6991/gitsigns.nvim/pull/1350
Did some exploring of the issue on the linked PR, hope it helps.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(vim.system): clear_env = true gives an invalid env to uv.spawn
